TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit SrgsItem extends System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsElement

Docs.summary: Represents a grammar element that contains phrases or other entities that a user can speak to produce a successful recognition.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem> object can consist of phrases, entities such as <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRuleRef> objects, logical combinations of phrases and <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRuleRef> objects, and so on. You can use the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.Elements%2A> property on the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem> class to gain access to the constituents of an <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem> object.
The order in which <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem> objects appear in a given <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRule> object specifies the order in which a user must speak them. By default, the contents of an <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem> must be spoken exactly once. To specify that the contents of an <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem> must be spoken repeatedly, use the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.%23ctor%2A> constructor and set the `repeatCount` parameter. Similarly, to specify a range for the number of times that an <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem> can be spoken, create the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem> with one of the constructors that set the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.MaxRepeat%2A> property and the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.MinRepeat%2A> property. If the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem> already exists, you can use one of the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.SetRepeat%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> or the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.SetRepeat%2A> methods to specify repeats.
You can also specify the probability that an item will be repeatedly spoken by setting the value of the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.RepeatProbability%2A> property.
<xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem> objects within an <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsOneOf> object comprise a list of alternatives from which the user can speak one. You can use the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.Weight%2A> property to specify the likelihood that a given item in the list will be spoken.
The <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem> class represents the `item` element that is defined in the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) [Speech Recognition Grammar Specification (SRGS) Version 1.0](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=201761). For information about the SRGS `item` element and details about its support by System.Speech, see [item Element](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/10cba7dd-994e-4aa7-907e-0669e5467d60).

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This overloaded constructer for <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem> initializes the object with a default `repeatCount` property of 0.

remarks.format:
## Remarks To set this property, use the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.SetRepeat%2A> method.
This property represents a portion of the `repeat` attribute defined by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) [Speech Recognition Grammar Specification (SRGS) Version 1.0](https://www.w3.org/TR/speech-grammar/).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the probability that a user will repeat the contents of this instance.
Docs.value: The probability, as a floating point value, that the contents of this item will be repeatedly spoken.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The property applies only to items whose <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.MinRepeat%2A> and <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.MaxRepeat%2A> properties have been explicitly set to non-default values, either by a constructor for <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem> or by the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem.SetRepeat%2A> method.

Docs.exception: An attempt is made to set to a value that is negative or larger than 1.0.

Docs.summary: Sets the repetition count for an item.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float Weight { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.Weight : single with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a multiplying factor that adjusts the likelihood that an in a object will be spoken.
Docs.value: A floating point value that adjusts the likelihood of this item being spoken.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default value of this property is 1.0, which is equivalent to no weighting of the item. A weight greater than 1.0 positively biases the likelihood that the item will be spoken, and a weight less than 1.0 negatively biases the likelihood that the item will be spoken.
This property is relevant only to <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsItem> objects within an <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsOneOf> instance; it is ignored in all other cases.

Docs.exception: An attempt is made to set to a negative value.
